result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachariah H. Reynolds

defendant.name: Reynolds, Zachariah H.
defendant.address: 1430 N Torun Road, #120, Stevens Point, WI 54482

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
15CM119 Count 1: $200 fine + costs + DNA surcharge
15CM119 Count 2 to be DRI
15CM220 to be DRI
15CM221 60 days jail, concurrent to presently serving sentences. Pay costs.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM119 and 15CM221 No contest pleas entered.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty15CM119 Count 1 & 15CM221.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CM119 Count 2 and 15CM220 are dismissed and read in.

Atty makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:*****
15CM119 Count 1: $200 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $705.00
15CM221: 60 days jail to commence immediately w/huber for work, concurrent to presently serving. Pay costs

Comply with all conditions in 15CM119 
Remanded to the Portage County Jail pending posting of the cash bail

6/1/15 Amended:  Bond now covers both 15CM220, 15CM221

Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds appeared by video.  Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM220, 15CM221

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond in 15CM220 now covers both files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Comply with all conditions in 15CM119 
Remanded to the Portage County Jail pending posting of the cash bail

Clerk is Shelley P.
11:01 a.m.  Court calls case.
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Misdemeanor Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant states that he "thinks" he is still a resident of the Portage House but he is not sure; stated he was having issues.
Defendant does state that he is employed.
State requests a cash bond of $500.00  with conditions as stated.
Defendant is requesting a signature bond.
Court makes statements to the defendant.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: June 1, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3.
